```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
```

Setting up the data
```{r}
technology <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2022/2022-07-19/technology.csv')

```

Data Wrangling
```{r}
DFtech <- 
  technology %>% 
  filter(category == "Energy") %>% 
  filter(year >= "2000") %>% 
  #filter(variable == c("elec_hydro", "elecprod")) %>% 
  filter(iso3c == "BRA") %>%
  mutate(newlabes = str_remove(label, "Electricity from ")) 

DFtech %>% 
  filter(!variable %in% c("elec_hydro", "elecprod")) %>% 
  


DFtech %>% 
  filter(year == "2020") %>% 
  slice_max(value, n = 5) %>% glimpse()
```

Making the Graph
```{r}
DFtech %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = year, y = value, color = label))+
  geom_line()+
  theme_minimal()+
  labs(
    title = "Different forms of Energy Production in Brazil",
    subtitle = "",
    caption = "The data comes from data.nber.org",
    )+
  xlab(NULL)+
  ylab(NULL)
```
